H0.text: It is drier at night, which is why many desert animals are more active at night.

H1.text: It is cooler at night, which is why many desert animals are more active at night.

H2.text: There is less danger at night, which explains why many desert animals are more active at night.

H3.text: There is less wind at night, which explains why many desert animals are more active at night.

A4.text: Avoiding the heat of the day helps desert animals conserve water.

A5.text: Nocturnality is a form of crypsis, an adaptation to avoid or enhance predation.

A6.text: During colder periods of the year, night-time temperatures can drop to freezing or below due to the exceptional radiation loss under the clear skies.
